alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 5:00AM CDT until July 21 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Anderson County in east Tennessee... Knox County in east Tennessee... * Until 845 AM EDT. * At 600 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooded roads across the warned area. Over 6 inches of rain have fallen in some places. Additional rainfall of up to 1.5 inches is possible in the warned area over the next several hours. Flash flooding is ongoing with several roads between Knoxville and Oak Ridge under water. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Alcoa, Oliver Springs, Rockford, Halls, Blaine, Rocky Top, Norris, Powell, Bearden, Karns, Andersonville, Maloneyville, Norris Dam State Park, Lake Forest, Mascot, House Mountain State Park and Kimberlin Heights. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
